paper.title: A Practical Mix
paper.venue: Theory and Application of Cryptographic Techniques
paper.abstract: We introduce a robust and efficient mix-network for exponentiation, and use it to obtain a threshold decryption mix-network for ElGamal encrypted messages, in which mix servers do not need to trust each other for the correctness of the result. If a subset of mix servers cheat, they will be caught with an overwhelming probability, and the decryption can restart after replacing them, in a fashion that is transparent to the participants providing the input to be decrypted. As long as a quorum is not controlled by an adversary, the privacy of the mix is guaranteed. Our solution is proved to be secure if a commonly used assumption, the Decision Diffie-Hellman assumption, holds.
